pullrequest.title: Integer indexing of the lyse DataFrame

content.raw:
I tested this and it works just fine \(except for the one comment that I left in the code\). 

I'm not sure about the naming of `run repeat`. Something along the lines of `repetition`, `repetition number`, `rep number` or `n_rep` would be a bit more descriptive in my opinion.

Also when or where is `sequence_index` being set in the h5 files? I can only find references to it in lyse.

    grep -r 'sequence_index' --include '*.py' *
    lyse/__init__.py:                df.set_index(['sequence_index', 'run number', 'run repeat'], inplace=True, drop=False)
    lyse/dataframe_utilities.py:            row['sequence_index'] = h5_file.attrs['sequence_index']
    lyse/dataframe_utilities.py:            row['sequence_index'] = None
    lyse/__main__.py:                header_cols = ['sequence_index', 'run number', 'run repeat']
content.html:
I tested this and it works just fine (except for the one comment that I left in the code).

I'm not sure about the naming of run repeat. Something along the lines of repetition, repetition number, rep number or n_rep would be a bit more descriptive in my opinion.

Also when or where is sequence_index being set in the h5 files? I can only find references to it in lyse.

grep -r 'sequence_index' --include '*.py' *
lyse/__init__.py:                df.set_index(['sequence_index', 'run number', 'run repeat'], inplace=True, drop=False)
lyse/dataframe_utilities.py:            row['sequence_index'] = h5_file.attrs['sequence_index']
lyse/dataframe_utilities.py:            row['sequence_index'] = None
lyse/__main__.py:                header_cols = ['sequence_index', 'run number', 'run repeat']
